---------- Forwarded message ---------
De: Gisela Tartaglia <gtartaglia@mate.unlp.edu.ar>
Date: lun, 1 nov 2021 a las 8:37
Subject: Seminario Geometría Noconmutativa : Martes 2/11 10hs
To: 


Hola, este martes a las 10:00hs tendremos el seminario virtual de Geometría Noconmutativa del Atlántico Sur (GeNoCAS).

En esta oportunidad va a hablar Elizabeth Gillaspy (Montana)

Title: The Weyl construction for dynamical Cartan subalgebras

Abstract: Building on earlier work of Kumjian, Renault proved in 2008 that a C*-algebra A has a Cartan subalgebra B iff A is the C*-algebra of a twist over a topologically principal groupoid W (the Weyl groupoid of the Cartan pair (B, A)).  However, one can build C*-algebras out of much more general groupoids.  Do those have Cartan subalgebras, and if so, what is the relationship between the Weyl groupoid and the original groupoid?

In joint work with A. Duwenig, R. Norton, S. Reznikoff, and S. Wright, we identified situations when a subgroupoid S of a non-principal groupoid G will give rise to a Cartan subalgebra B = C*(S) of A = C*(G).  Subsequent work, joint with A. Duwenig and R. Norton, revealed that the Weyl groupoid W of the pair (B, A) is a semidirect product: W = G/S ⋉Å .  We also describe the Weyl twist explicitly in the situation where there is a continuous section G/S → G.

If you're still mostly lost after reading this abstract, never fear! The talk will not assume familiarity with groupoids, their C*-algebras, or Cartan subalgebras for C*-algebras, and should (I hope) be more comprehensible.

Guillermo Cortiñas y Gisela Tartaglia
